publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3686 Frances Curran: Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the East Renfrewshire Domestic Abuse Website which coincided with the 16 days of activism to end violence against women; acknowledges the need to tackle violence against women wherever it is exposed, and further acknowledges that, although progress is being made, there is still a long way to go in raising understanding especially amongst those in public life.

S2M-3686 Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire (lodged on 6 December 2005) Carolyn Leckie*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rosie Kane*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3686 Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire (lodged on 6 December 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Nora Radcliffe*, Tommy Sheridan*

S2M-3686 Frances Curran: Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the East Renfrewshire Domestic Abuse Website which coincided with the 16 days of activism to end violence against women; acknowledges the need to tackle violence against women wherever it is exposed, and further acknowledges that, although progress is being made, there is still a long way to go in raising understanding especially amongst those in public life. Supported by: Carolyn Leckie, Campbell Martin, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rosie Kane, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Donald Gorrie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Nora Radcliffe, Tommy Sheridan
S2M-3686 Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire (lodged on 6 December 2005) Colin Fox*, Robin Harper*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3686 Stop Violence Against Women in East Renfrewshire (lodged on 6 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
